div.p: No. 3464, unit 637, VPRS 3181/P Town Clerk's file series 1, VA 511 Melbourne, Public Record Office, Victoria.

See also M to J. Clayton, 26 March 1896. S. Yarra,
Melb. 21/9/96,

The Townclerk
or: TownsClerk??
of Melbourne

Am much gratified dear Mr Clayton with the kindly expressions bestowed by their Right Worships the Mayors of Melbourne
Letter not found.?
and St. Louis
See [T. Henri] to J. Clayton, 14 August 1896. on my sending of seeds of sanitary trees for Mauritius,
See M to J. Clayton, 20 March 1896. and it hardly needs my assurance, that I will continue these transmissions even of still further kinds from time to time as opportunities may occur here. The Right Worshipful and Honorable C. Pitot mentions in his letter under date 14th Aug.
This refers to the letter [T. Henri] requested be forwarded to M, see [T. Henri] to J. Clayton, 14 August 1896.
that the seeds then had not yet arrived, but as you cautiously caused them to be registered, they are sure to have come still to hand. Should however a mishap in the communication have occurred, I will make up another collection.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p:
Ferd von Mueller.
On 29 October 1896, J. Henri, Town Clerk, Port Louis, Mauritius, wrote to John Clayton: 'I have the honour to acknowledge the receipt of your letter dated 19th September last, advising me that you have duly forwarded to Baron Sir Ferdinand von Mueller, Government Botanist, and to Mr W. R. Guilfoyle, Director of the Melbourne Gardens, the letters addressed to you, for transmission to these gentlemen. His Worship the Mayor directs me to inform you that the further supply, advised in your letter of 28th August, of eucalyptus seeds obtained by the courtesy of the Secretary for lands of your Colony have not yet come to hand. I am further commissioned by His Worship to convey to you his best thanks for your kindness & to renew his offer for reciprocating, should he be of any service to his colleague of Melbourne or to any of his colleagues of Australia.' 'have not ... to hand' underlined by Clayton and annotated in margin: '?'.This refers to a letters 19 September and 28 August from Mayor Melbourne to Mauritius. Get copy from outwards correspondence.
